1.text: And this know, that in the last days difficult times shall interpose.

2.text: For men shall be self-lovers, lovers of money, boastful, proud, slandering, disobedient to parents, unthankful, wicked,

3.text: Devoid of natural affection, not observing treaties, accusers, ungoverned, wild, not loving the good,

4.text: Traitors, rash, haughty, devoted to pleasure more than loving God;

5.text: Having a form of devotion, and having denied its power: and these renounce.

6.text: For of these are they going into houses, and taking captive little women heaped up with sins, led away with various eager desires,

7.text: Always learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

8.text: And as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so also these have withstood the truth: men corrupted in mind, not tried concerning the faith.

9.text: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest to all, as theirs also was.

10.text: And thou hast closely followed my doctrine, mode of life, purpose, faith, long suffering, love, patience,

11.text: Expulsions, sufferings, which were to me in Antioch, in Iconium, in Lystra; what expulsions I endured: and the Lord delivered me from all.

12.text: And all wishing to live devotedly in Christ Jesus shall be driven out.

13.text: And evil men and impostors shall proceed to worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

14.text: And remain thou in what things thou hast learned and hast been convinced of, knowing of whom thou hast learned;

15.text: And that from infancy thou hast known the holy letters, able to render thee wise to salvation by faith which in Christ Jesus.

16.text: All writing divinely inspired, and profitable for doctrine, for refutation, for correction, for instruction in justice:

17.text: That the man of God might be perfect, finished for every good work.
